revised_title: Second-law limitations on particle size distribution functions: Applications to Smoluchowski's coagulation theory and Friedlander's self-preserving distribution
tldr: The author introduces an entropy-related property of particle dispersion to identify the limitations of particle size distribution functions. This approach is applied to Smoluchowski's coagulation theory and Friedlander's self-preserving distribution, demonstrating its potential in evaluating particle size distributions in dispersions.
